articles.title: The 10 Trends That Shaped Fashion for T in 2019
articles.description: Slouchy leather separates, new takes on suiting, floral prints for men and more.
articles.content:
As seen in Fashion for a Specific Sort of Island-Hopping photographed by Viviane Sassen, styled by Vanessa Reid.
For the Nov. 17 Travel issue, T received dispatches from Milos, Greece, the Aland Islands of Finland, the taro fields of Hawaii and Japan. Meanwh… [+237 chars]

articles.author: Margalit Fox
articles.title: Abbey Simon, Masterly Pianist, Dies at 99
articles.description: Mr. Simon, light of touch yet breathtakingly pyrotechnic, was known for his interpretations of the Romantic literature.
articles.content:
After the success of his first European tour in 1949, Mr. Simon moved to Europe for more than a decade, living primarily in Switzerland.
There ought to be a law, Robert Sherman wrote in The Times in 1965, bemoaning the rarity of Mr. Simons appearances in the… [+1030 chars]

articles.author: Jamie Stockwell
articles.title: I Sent a Reporter to Warroad. We Returned Together for a ‘Whip’ Around Town.
articles.description: It was a rare chance to see the story — and the people in this small Minnesota town — through his eyes.
articles.content: So there we were on a cold October morning, and the mayor wasnt in at The Shed, leaving me and Richard with a couple of hours to kill before we were due at the high school to speak to students and residents about journalism. Richard drove me to what had been … [+2285 chars]

articles.author: Michael Levenson
articles.title: At Least 6 Killed in Las Vegas Apartment Fire, Officials Say
articles.description: The fire broke out early on Saturday and quickly filled the three-story building with smoke, inundating the upper floors, where several residents jumped from windows, an official said.
articles.content:
At least six people were killed and 13 injured in an early-morning apartment fire in Las Vegas on Saturday, a spokesman for Las Vegas Fire and Rescue said.
The fire in the 42-unit building broke out around 4:13 a.m. near a stove in a first-floor unit, the sp… [+445 chars]

articles.author: Erin Aubry Kaplan
articles.title: The Poverty and Prosperity of Losing My Husband
articles.description: The financial planning he’d done his whole life paid off — to me, not him.
articles.content: Then roughly halfway through our marriage, in the late aughts, the journalism business began to come apart. I started losing gigs and getting paid dramatically less than the salary I had started married life with: We were no longer equally yoked. Though our l… [+2480 chars]

articles.author: Sarah Elizabeth Richards
articles.title: What Happened to All Those Frozen Eggs?
articles.description: Egg freezing was supposed to be as revolutionary as birth control. It hasn’t lived up to the hype — but it has still changed women’s lives.
articles.content: And women responded to this promise. In 2009, the first year the Society for Assisted Reproductive Technology started collecting egg freezing data, 475 women went through the procedure, in which an average of 10 eggs are surgically removed and preserved in li… [+1577 chars]

articles.title: How to Turn Anger and Fear Into Political Power
articles.description: Latinos in Arizona can show how it’s done.
articles.content: Election Day 2016 held another victory that had been in the works for a while. We learned at listening sessions with our 2,600 members, whom weve cultivated through neighborhood teams and high school civics clubs, that they wanted us to fight for higher wages… [+2011 chars]
